resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
andersonm-ibm opened a new pull request, #12935:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12935

   sizeof is indeed unnecessary here. 
   And no need to initialize the buffer to 0 either before using rand_bytes(), if the AAD is the full length of the buffer.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #12935:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12935#issuecomment-1103797849

   <!--
     Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
     or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file

       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

     software distributed under the License is distributed on an
     "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
     KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
     specific language governing permissions and limitations
     under the License.
   -->
   
   Thanks for opening a pull request!
   
   If this is not a [minor PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#Minor-Fixes). Could you open an issue for this pull request on JIRA? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW
   
   Opening JIRAs ahead of time contributes to the [Openness](http://theapacheway.com/open/#:~:text=Openness%20allows%20new%20users%20the,must%20happen%20in%20the%20open.) of the Apache Arrow project.
   
   Then could you also rename pull request title in the following format?
   
       ARROW-${JIRA_ID}: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   or
   
       MINOR: [${COMPONENT}] ${SUMMARY}
   
   See also:
   
     * [Other pull requests](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pulls/)
     * [Contribution Guidelines - How to contribute patches](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/contributing.html#how-to-contribute-patches)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body: Looking at the fix now, this is a potentially critical security issue (I'm not sure what kAadFileUniqueLength is for?)
Ok, after reading the Parquet encryption spec, this is probably not security-critical. It's just a way of avoiding filename collisions.

_not security-critical. It's just a way of avoiding filename collisions._

 

Agreed. This does not affect data encryption and doesn't leak sensitive data. The unique file names are a preparation for a future capability (e2e data integrity protection), which is currently a WIP anyway.
